title: Peru’s Foreign Trade and Tourism Budget 2016 increasesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Peru’s Foreign Trade and Tourism Budget 2016 increases  
Peru’s Foreign Trade and Tourism Minister, Magali Silva, reported before the Committee on Budget the 0.6% increase in 2016 tourism budget compared to that of 2015.
 
Ministry of Foreign Trade and Tourism’s 2016 budget project has increased to S/. 502.3 million (about US$155.5 million).
 
Silva said Mincetur will continue working on market opening and identification through Peru’s 36 Trade Offices (OCEX) based in overseas.
 
Efforts to ease trade by reducing bureaucratic barriers and boosting exports will also be pursued, she said.
 
Mincetur 2016’s budget stands at S/.280.9 million (about US$86.96 million); Peru’s Export and Tourism Promotion Board (PromPeru) at S/.199.70 million (about US$61.82 million) and S/.21.7 (about US$6.71 million) for the Center for Training in Tourism (Cenfotur).
